current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To extend duty-free treatment for certain trousers, breeches, or shorts imported from Nicaragua, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Extension of duty-free treatment for certain trousers, breeches, or shorts imported from Nicaragua

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ,  eligible apparel articles shall enter the United States free of duty if such eligible apparel articles are accompanied by an earned import allowance certificate for the amount of credits equal to the total square meter equivalents of fabric in such eligible apparel articles, in accordance with the program established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b
Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: Notwithstanding the termination of the tariff preference level program for imports of apparel articles from Nicaragua and subject to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , duty-free treatment under this section shall be extended for a covered calendar year to an initial limit of not more than 50,000,000 square meter equivalents of eligible apparel articles unless that amount is increased pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for such year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:3

text.#text: Subject to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text: If during a covered calendar year duty-free  treatment under this section is extended to 90 percent or more of the initial limit for such year  prior to the end of such year, the
extend such treatment to an additional amount of square meter equivalents of eligible apparel articles  that is equal to 10 percent of the initial limit for such year; and
publish notice of the extension in the Federal Register.

increase the initial limit for subsequent covered calendar years by an additional amount of square meter equivalents of eligible apparel articles  that is equal to 10 percent of the initial limit for each covered calendar year of the previous 3-year period; and
publish notice of such increase in the Federal Register.

text.#text: The aggregate square meter equivalents of eligible apparel articles of each producer or entity controlling production that may receive duty-free treatment under this section  during a covered calendar year may not exceed the aggregate square meter equivalents of fabric  wholly formed in the United States of yarns wholly formed in the United States that was previously exported from the United States by such producer or entity and for which the producer or entity has available credits in its account established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a program to provide earned import allowance certificates to any producer or entity controlling production of eligible apparel articles for purposes of
, based on the elements described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a
Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:3

text.#text: The
The elements described in this paragraph are the following:

One credit shall be issued to a producer or an entity controlling production for every one square meter equivalent of fabric wholly formed in the United States from yarns wholly formed in the United States that such producer or entity demonstrates has been exported from the customs territory of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall create and maintain an account for such producer or entity into which credits issued under
may be deposited.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:3/sp:A

text.#text: If requested by a producer or entity controlling production, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for earned import allowance certificates for such number of credits such producer or entity may request and has available.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:3/sp:A

text.#text: A producer or entity controlling production may redeem credits issued under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may require that a producer or entity controlling production submit documentation to verify the export of fabric wholly formed in the United States of yarns wholly formed in the United States.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may reconcile discrepancies in the information provided under
and verify the accuracy of such information.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:3/sp:D

text.#text: The

The program shall be established so as to allow, to the extent feasible, the submission, storage, retrieval, and disclosure of information in electronic format, including information with respect to the earned import allowance certificates.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish procedures to carry out the program under this subsection by October 1, 2014, and may establish additional requirements to carry out the program.

text.#text: The

If an importer, producer, or entity controlling production enters into the customs territory of the United States eligible apparel articles for which there are insufficient earned credits,  such importer, producer, or entity may be subject to a penalty equal to the value of such eligible apparel articles, in addition to existing penalties under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as appropriate.

text.#text: For purposes of determining the quantity of
In this section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Extending Incentives for Exporting American Textiles Act of 2013/s:2/ss:e

term.#tail: means a calendar year during the 10-year period referred to in

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means woven trousers, breeches, or shorts that are apparel articles described in subdivisions (a) and  (b) of U.S. Note 15 to subchapter XV of chapter 99 of the HTS imported from Nicaragua.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: include a withdrawal from warehouse for consumption.

text.#text: The terms

term.#tail: means a person or other entity or group that is not a producer and that controls the production process in Nicaragua through a contractual relationship or other indirect means.

text.#text: The term

header.#text: Fabric wholly formed in the United States of yarn wholly formed in the United States

term.#text: fabric wholly formed in the United States of yarn wholly formed in the United States

text.#text: The term
woven in the United States from fibers or from yarns, the constituent staple fibers of which are spun in the United States or the continuous filament of which is extruded in the United States;
for which any dyeing, printing, or finishing is performed in the United States; and
exported to Nicaragua on or after April 1, 2014.

term.#tail: means the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of this Act.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the quantity of square meter equivalents of eligible apparel articles that may be extended duty-free treatment under this section on the first day of a calendar year.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means a person or other entity or group that exercises direct, daily operational control over the production process in Nicaragua.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: refers to the preferential tariff treatment for nonoriginating apparel goods of Nicaragua established pursuant to Article 3.28 of the Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement and the letters described in
term.#text: tariff preference level program for imports of apparel articles from Nicaragua

header.#text: Tariff preference level program for imports of apparel articles from Nicaragua

text.#text: Duty-free treatment under this section shall be in effect for the  10-year period beginning on January 1, 2015.
